title: getting-started
code: Make the project citable (3e) by including a CITATION file in the project's  home directory that describes how to cite this project as a whole, and where  to find (and how to cite) any data sets, code, figures, and other artifacts  that have their own DOIs.  Please cite this work as: Morris, B.D. and E.P. White. 2013. 'The EcoData Retriever: improving access to existing ecological data.'PLOS ONE 8:e65848. http://doi.org/doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0065848

title: getting-started
code: # Requirements    'Make dependencies and requirements explicit. This is usually done on a  per-project rather than per-program basis, i.e., by adding a file called  something like requirements.txt to the root directory of the project'   source: https://swcarpentry.github.io/good-enough-practices-in-scientific-computing/

what: Good Enough Data Storage and Use
title: getting-started
text: Create folder keeping raw data separate data files. contents data/README.md file also provide guidance storing documenting data.
code: goodenuffR::goodenuff_data() # data # ├── README.md # └── raw # Project Data    For guidance please see: https://help.osf.io/hc/en-us/articles/360019739054-How-to-Make-a-Data-Dictionary  ## Additional Resources  1. Sharing data http://bit.ly/data-4-sharing  2. Data in spreadsheets http://bit.ly/data-in-sheets  3. External data (https://r-pkgs.org/) https://r-pkgs.org/data.html  source: https://swcarpentry.github.io/good-enough-practices-in-scientific-computing/

title: getting-started
text: goodenuffR::goodenuff_doc() function creates three files document project. notebook.Rmd html_notebook, manuscript.Rmd pdf_document (written rmarkdown).

title: getting-started
text: Read rmarkdown . changelog.txt plain text file (‘manual version control’).
code: ....a running draft of a manuscript describing the project findings   source: https://swcarpentry.github.io/good-enough-practices-in-scientific-computing/

previous_headings: Create new projects > Create all project files > Good Enough Documentation
title: getting-started
code: ..make dated notes about changes to the project in this file in reverse  chronological order (i.e., most recent first). This file is the equivalent of  a lab notebook, and should contain entries like those shown below.  ## 2016-04-08  * Switched to cubic interpolation as default.  * Moved question about family's TB history to end of questionnaire.  ## 2016-04-06  * Added option for cubic interpolation.  * Removed question about staph exposure (can be inferred from blood test results).   source: https://swcarpentry.github.io/good-enough-practices-in-scientific-computing/

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin Frigaard. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Frigaard M (2022). goodenuffR: Create project folder. R package version 0.2.1, https://mjfrigaard.github.io/goodenuffR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {goodenuffR: Create a project folder},   author = {Martin Frigaard},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.1},   url = {https://mjfrigaard.github.io/goodenuffR/}, }

title: Create a project folder
text: goodenuffR package based excellent advice paper, “Good Enough Practices Scientific Computing” Wilson et al.  goal goodenuffR create files folders outlined paper (like folder tree )
code: |-- CITATION |-- README |-- LICENSE |-- requirements.txt |-- data |   -- birds_count_table.csv |-- doc |   -- notebook.md |   -- manuscript.md |   -- changelog.txt |-- results |   -- summarized_results.csv |-- src |   -- sightings_analysis.py |   -- runall.py

title: Create a project folder
text: can install Github version :

title: Create a project folder
text: Run : run : ’ll see :
code: library(goodenuffR) goodenuffR::goodenuff_project(   project_name = "my project", folder_path = "~/projects") library(goodenuffR) goodenuff_files() ├── CITATION ├── LICENSE ├── README.Rmd ├── code │   ├── 01-import.R │   ├── 02-tidy.R │   ├── 03-wrangle.R │   ├── 04-visualize.R │   ├── 05-model.R │   ├── 06-communicate.R │   └── runall.R ├── data │   ├── README.md │   └── raw ├── docs │   ├── changelog.txt │   ├── manuscript.Rmd │   └── notebook.Rmd ├── my_project.Rproj ├── requirements.txt └── results     ├── figures     ├── manuscript     └── tables

text: fun_headr() function similar hot keys 'cmd + shift + R' creating section header.

text: fun_headr

title: Create a (fun) R Script Header — fun_headr
code: # use this to create a fun section header in any .R file # (with RStudio open) # fun_headr("packages")

title: goodenuff_code — goodenuff_code
text: Create code folder import, tidy, wrangle, visualize, model, communicate, runall

title: goodenuff_collab — goodenuff_collab
text: Create collaboration files: CITATION, requirements.txt, LICENSE (source: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.txt)

title: goodenuff_data — goodenuff_data
text: Create data folder, README.md file, raw sub-folder.

title: good enuff R documentation — goodenuff_doc
text: Create doc folder notebook.Rmd, manuscript.Rmd,     changelog.txt files.

title: goodenuff_files — goodenuff_files
text: Create project files.

title: Insert goodenuff script header — goodenuff_header
text: goodenuff_header() function can used new R script     create header. header includes sections : - code creates - author - MIT License - Version

title: Insert goodenuff script header — goodenuff_header
code: # use this to create a script header (with RStudio open) # goodenuff_header()

what: Create a new goodenuffR project — goodenuff_project

text: Create open new 'good enough' project.

title: Create a new goodenuffR project — goodenuff_project
Create a new goodenuffR project — goodenuff_project
text: project_name name project parent_folder parent folder project

title: goodenuff_results — goodenuff_results
text: Create results folder figures, tables, manuscript sub-folders.

title: goodenuffR 0.2.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. New goodenuff_project() function (converts paths lowercase)
